subject: Parenting
title: The Attachment Revolution
description: Learn The Attachment Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: John Bowlby watched orphaned children and saw something that changed psychology forever: grief.

buildup.text: Post-war orphanages showed children who were fed and clothed but emotionally starved.

discovery.text: Bowlby proposed that children have an inborn need for a close emotional bond with a caregiver.

twist.text: The medical establishment ridiculed him. Behaviorists called attachment theory sentimental nonsense.

climax.text: Decades of research proved him right. Attachment theory is now the foundation of developmental psychology.

punchline.text: The man who said babies need love was laughed at â€” then proven right.

quiz.question: What did John Bowlby observe that led to attachment theory?
options: Orphaned children showing grief and emotional deprivation
Children performing well in strict environments
Babies learning language earlier than expected
